meanings.definition: A piece of furniture designed for sitting on.
meanings.sent1: The wooden seat in the park was perfect for resting.
meanings.sent2: She found a comfortable seat by the window in the cafe.
meanings.sent3: The seat at the picnic table seemed to be whispering 'sit here'.
meanings.sent4: His throne was a seat of power and authority.
meanings.sent5: The seat on the swing swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A place or space occupied by something.
meanings.sent1: The front seat of the car was reserved for the driver.
meanings.sent2: The empty seat at the table was waiting for its occupant.
meanings.sent3: The seat of the bicycle was missing, making it impossible to ride.
meanings.sent4: The seat of government was located in the capital city.
meanings.sent5: The seat on the bus was warm from the previous passenger.

meanings.sent1: Please seat yourself at the dining table for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to seat themselves in a circle.
meanings.sent3: He tried to seat the cat in the tiny dollhouse chair for fun.
meanings.sent4: The hostess will seat you at your table shortly.
meanings.sent5: The flight attendant will seat you in the emergency exit row.

meanings.definition: To be entitled to a particular position or status.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, she finally seated herself as the CEO.
meanings.sent2: He was seated as the head of the committee due to his expertise.
meanings.sent3: The young prince was seated as the ruler of the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The champion was seated as the best player in the league.
meanings.sent5: She was seated as the winner of the prestigious award.
